myStories.caption: The twin towers of the World Trade Center burn after hijacked planes crashed into them on September 11, 2001 in New York City.(AP Photo/Louis Lanzano)// ASSOCIATED PRESS
myStories.text: The September 11 attacks kill nearly 3,000 people. Terrorists crash passenger jets into the Twin Towers of the World Trade Center in Manhattan and the Pentagon in Virginia, and a fourth airplane crashes in a western Pennsylvania field.

myStories.caption: A special forces officer helps a female out of the theater where hundreds of hostages were being held by Chechen rebels, in Moscow, early Saturday Oct. 26, 2002. Special forces troops took control of a Moscow theater before sunrise Saturday where hundreds of hostages were being held by Chechen rebels, killing their leader and freeing all their captives. (AP Photo/Dmitry Lovetsky)// A WOMAN IS ESCORTED OUT OF THE THEATER IN MOSCOW. ASSOCIATED PRESS
myStories.text: Forty Chechen fighters seize Moscow's Dubrovka Theater and hold nearly 1,000 people hostage, killing two. Russian special forces storm the building after pumping a chemical agent into the ventilation system, killing all 40 terrorists and some 130 hostages because of an adverse reaction to the gas.
myStories.caption-edited: A woman is escorted out of the theater in Moscow. PHOTO: ASSOCIATED PRESS

myStories.number-text: 202 dead, in the final death toll
myStories.Fatalities-confimed-by-another-news-sour: But Bali police spokesman Yatim Suyatmo said an additional eight people had died in hospitals overseas as a result of their injuries.
myStories.caption: The wreckage of the Sari night club and surrounding buildings are seen in this aerial view Tuesday, Oct. 15, 2002 in Kuta, Bali.  Two powerful explosions near the popular night spot killed over 180 people and left hundreds injured in the worst ever terrorist attack in Indonesia. (AP Photo/Achmad Ibrahim)//WRECKAGE OF THE NIGHT CLUB SEEN IN BALI. ASSOCIATED PRESS
myStories.text: Indonesian officials blame al Qaeda for a car bomb that kills nearly 190 people on the Indonesian holiday island of Bali.
myStories.caption-edited: Site of the attack in Bali. PHOTO: ASSOCIATED PRESS

myStories.caption: Bodies of victims are evacuated after a train exploded near the Atocha train station in Madrid 11 March 2004. At least 131 people were killed and some 400 injured early 11 March 2004 in near-simultaneous explosions on three trains in Madrid at the height of morning commuter traffic, the Spanish interior ministry said. In what appeared to be a deliberate attack staged only 72 hours ahead of Spanish general elections, the blasts went off on a long-distance high-speed carrier and two suburban trains packed with commuters.        (Photo credit should read CHRISTOPHE SIMON/AFP/Getty Images) ///
myStories.text: Coordinated bomb attacks hit four Spanish commuter trains in Madrid, killing 191 people. Spanish investigators blame an al Qaeda-linked terror cell.
myStories.caption-edited: Wreckage of a train hit by a bomb in Atocha, Madrid. PHOTO: AGENCE FRANCE-PRESSE/GETTY IMAGES

myStories.caption: Special forces soldiers evacuate a little girl and a woman, apparently after they escaped from a school, which is seized by attackers in the town of Beslan, about 15 kilometers (10 miles) north of Vladikavkaz, the capital of North Ossetia, a republic that borders warring Chechnya, in this image taken from television, Wednesday, Sept.1, 2004. About a score of attackers bearing guns and wrapped in suicide-bomb belts seized a school in the Russian region of North Ossetia Wednesday morning and were in a gun battle with police. (AP Photo/RTR, Russian Television, via APTN) /// A WOMAN AND A GIRL ESCAPE FROM THE SCHOOL IN BESLAN. APTN/ASSOCIATED PRESS
myStories.text: A massacre leaves more than 330 dead, around half of them children, after Islamist terrorists take 1,200 people hostage in Beslan, North Ossetia, an autonomous Russian republic. The siege lasts for three days.
myStories.caption-edited: A woman and a girl escape in Beslan. PHOTO: APTN/ASSOCIATED PRESS

myStories.caption: **  FILE  **  A forensic officer walks next to the wreckage of a double decker bus with its top blown off and damaged cars scattered on the road at Tavistock Square in central London in this  Thursday, July 7, 2005, file photo. A string of rush-hour explosions blamed on Islamic terrorists tore into at least three London subway trains and a double-decker bus on Thursday. Friday July 7, 2006 marks the first anniversary of the terrorist attacks in London  that killed  52 commuters.  (AP Photo/Sang Tan)
myStories.text: Four coordinated attacks by suicide bombers rip through London subway trains and a bus, killing 52 rush-hour commuters. The killers are later identified as British al Qaeda sympathizers Shehzad Tanweer, Hasib Hussain, Mohammed Sidique Khan and Jermaine Lindsay.
myStories.caption-edited: Wreckage of a bus in London. PHOTO: ASSOCIATED PRESS

myStories.caption: Indian army soldiers take position during a gun battle at the Taj Mahal hotel (seen in the background) in Mumbai November 29, 2008. Operations by Indian commandos to dislodge Islamist militants at Mumbai's Taj Mahal hotel ended on Saturday, Indian television channels quoted officials as saying. The hotel came under heavy gunfire and flames leaped out of the building shortly before the announcement.  REUTERS/Desmond Boylan (INDIA) - RTR222U1
myStories.text: A 60-hour siege by 10 militants from Pakistan on India’s biggest city and financial capital kills 166 people. India claims the terrorists who perpetrated the attacks on luxury hotels, a Jewish center and other sites were operatives of the Pakistan-based militant group Lashkar-e-Taiba.
myStories.caption-edited: Taj Mahal hotel during the attack. PHOTO: REUTERS

myStories.caption: Forensic experts examine the site of a shooting at the Jewish museum in Brussels, Saturday, May 24, 2014. Belgian officials say that at least three people have been killed in gunfire at the Jewish Museum in Brussels. Belgian Foreign Minister Didier Reynders, in a post on Twitter, said he was
myStories.text: A gunman murders four people at the Jewish Museum of Belgium in Brussels. Mehdi Nemmouche, a French national with ties to Islamic State, is arrested and charged with the killings.
myStories.caption-edited: Investigators seek clues outside the museum. PHOTO: ASSOCIATED PRESS

myStories.caption: Pakistani volunteers carry a student injured in the shootout at a school under attack by Taliban gunmen, at a local hospital in Peshawar, Pakistan,Tuesday, Dec. 16, 2014. Taliban gunmen stormed a military school in the northwestern Pakistani city, killing and wounding dozens, officials said, in the latest militant violence to hit the already troubled region. (AP Photo/Mohammad Sajjad)
myStories.text: Taliban gunmen storm a military-run school in northwestern Pakistan and kill at least 148 people, methodically shooting schoolchildren in the head and setting fire to some victims in a horrifying nine-hour rampage.
myStories.caption-edited: Volunteers carry an injured student. PHOTO: ASSOCIATED PRESS

myStories.caption: Gunmen gesture as they return to their car after the attack outside the offices of French satirical weekly newspaper Charlie Hebdo (seen at rear) in this still image taken from amateur video shot in Paris January 7, 2015. Twelve people were slain, including two police officers, during last week's attack by Islamist militants Cherif and Said Kouachi. REUTERS/Reuters TV     (FRANCE - Tags: CRIME LAW MEDIA TPX IMAGES OF THE DAY) - RTR4LARW
myStories.text: Islamist extremists kill a total of 17 people at Paris-based satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo and a kosher grocery in the city.
myStories.caption-edited: Gunmen gesture after the attack. PHOTO: REUTERS

myStories.caption: An injured woman is comforted following an explosion at the main train station in Turkey's capital Ankara, on October 10, 2015. At least 30  people were killed and 126 were injured in the explosion which happened ahead of an anti-government peace rally organised by leftist groups later in the day, including the pro-Kurdish Peoples' Democratic Party (HDP).  AFP PHOTO / ADEM ALTAN        (Photo credit should read ADEM ALTAN/AFP/Getty Images)
myStories.text: Twin suicide bombings kill about 95 people in the Turkish capital of Ankara. The Turkish government first attributes the attacks to Islamic State, but later says an inquiry points to the Kurdish Workers' Party, or PKK.
myStories.caption-edited: People outside Ankara train station. PHOTO: AGENCE FRANCE-PRESSE/GETTY IMAGES

myStories.caption: TOPSHOTS A handout picture taken on November 1, 2015 and released on November 3, 2015 by Russia's Emergency Ministry shows the wreckage of a A321 Russian airliner in Wadi al-Zolomat, a mountainous area of Egypt's Sinai Peninsula. Russian airline Kogalymavia's flight 9268 crashed en route from Sharm el-Sheikh to Saint Petersburg on October 31, killing all 224 people on board, the vast majority of them Russian tourists. wreckage of a A321  AFP PHOTO / RUSSIA'S EMERGENCY MINISTRY / MAXIM GRIGORYEV *RESTRICTED TO EDITORIAL USE - MANDATORY CREDIT AFP PHOTO / RUSSIA'S EMERGENCY MINISTRY / MAXIM GRIGORYEV - NO MARKETING NO ADVERTISING CAMPAIGNS - DISTRIBUTED AS A SERVICE TO CLIENTS *MAXIM GRIGORYEV/AFP/Getty Images
myStories.text: A Russian-operated jet crashes in Egypt, killing all 224 people on board, in what appears to have been a terrorist act. Islamic State claims responsibility.

myStories.caption: TUNIS, TUNISIA - MARCH 18 :  Museum attack hostages are seen after Tunisian Security forces start an operation as gunmen reportedly took hostages at the Bardo Museum in Tunis, Tunisia on March 18, 2015. Gunmen opened fire at the Bardo Museum in Tunisia's capital, killing 21 people including 17 tourists, the Tunisian Prime Minister said. (Photo by Ezer Mnasri/Anadolu Agency/Getty Images)
myStories.text: Several men carry out a shooting attack at the Bardo National Museum in Tunisia's capital, killing 21. Islamic State claims responsibility.
myStories.caption-edited: Hostages are released. PHOTO: GETTY IMAGES

myStories.caption: Students of the Garissa University College take shelter in a vehicle after fleeing from an attack by gunmen in Garissa, Kenya, Thursday, April 2, 2015. Gunmen attacked the university early Thursday, shooting indiscriminately in campus hostels. Police and military surrounded the buildings and were trying to secure the area in eastern Kenya, police officer Musa Yego said. (AP Photo)
myStories.text: Heavily armed gunmen storm a university campus in Kenya, setting off a rampage that leaves about 150 dead in an attack associated with Somalia-based Islamist group al-Shabaab.
myStories.caption-edited: Students take shelter. PHOTO: ASSOCIATED PRESS

myStories.caption: Tunisian men help an injured woman in the resort town of Sousse, a popular tourist destination 140 kilometres (90 miles) south of the Tunisian capital, on June 26, 2015, following a shooting attack. At least 27 people, including foreigners, were killed in a mass shooting at a Tunisian beach resort packed with holidaymakers, in the North African country's worst attack in recent history. AFP PHOTO / FETHI BELAID        (Photo credit should read FETHI BELAID/AFP/Getty Images)
myStories.text: A lone gunman storms a beach resort in Tunisia, killing 37 people. Islamic State claims responsibility. On the same day, a man decapitates his boss at a U.S.-owned industrial gas plant in southeastern France.
myStories.caption-edited: A victim gets help in Sousse, Tunis. PHOTO: AGENCE FRANCE-PRESSE/GETTY IMAGES

myStories.caption: Members of the Lebanese police forces and Hezbollah inspect the site of a twin suicide attack in the Bourj al-Barajneh suburb of Beirut, Lebanon, Nov. 15, 2015. According to local sources at least 43 civilians were killed and over 235 wounded when two suicide attackers blew themselves up 12 November near a busy market outside the al-Imam al-Hussein mosque on al-Husseiniya street in the suburb with a large Hezbollah presence. The group calling themselves the Islamic State (IS) has claimed responsibility for the attack, after which a day of mourning was decalred in Lebanon for 13 November.  EPA/WAEL HAMZEH
myStories.text: A double suicide bombing in a Beirut suburb kills around 43 people, in an attack that bore the hallmarks of Sunni militants linked to al Qaeda and other extremist groups.
myStories.caption-edited: Police inspect the site in Beirut. PHOTO: EUROPEAN PRESSPHOTO AGENCY

myStories.caption: Turkish policemen stand next to bodies of victims on July 20, 2015 after an explosion in the town of Suruc, not far from the Syrian border. At least 30 people were killed and hundreds injured in a suicide bombing aiming the garden of a cultural centre where young left-wing activists and pro-Kurds lived. Turkish officials largely blamed the attack on Islamic State militants. AFP PHOTO / ILYAS AKENGIN        (Photo credit should read ILYAS AKENGIN/AFP/Getty Images)
myStories.text: Turkey’s government blames Islamic State for a suicide bombing in a Kurdish border town that kills at least 31 people, one of the worst cases of spillover violence from the 4 1/2-year conflict in neighboring Syria.
myStories.caption-edited: Police stand next to bodies in Suruc, Syria. PHOTO: AGENCE FRANCE-PRESSE/GETTY IMAGES
